context: In a recent security incident, a suspicious service registration was detected involving a system program `services.exe`, which may suggest malicious intent to establish persistence or gain system privileges. This incident was connected to a series of suspicious exploration activities that involved executing a set of Windows commands to identify valuable assets and coordinate lateral movement. A user Luciano Herrera (pwilson@niseko.alpineskihouse.co) performed an unusual addition of credentials to the application SimulandApp, indicating a potential compromise used for phishing, data exfiltration, or unauthorized access.
question: What is the OAuthObjectId of the application SimulandApp to which Luciano Herrera added the unusual credentials?
solution_steps: A suspicious service was registered on the host `mb-adfs`.
A process named `powershell.exe` was involved in a suspicious sequence of exploration activities.
The suspicious sequence of exploration activities was associated with an account having SID `S-1-5-21-551436448-9871687716-9837441745-1903`.
An unusual addition of credentials was made to an OAuth application with OAuthObjectId `a66a4b44-d1f7-4563-95bf-a89d1b05b325` by the user Luciano Herrera (pwilson@niseko.alpineskihouse.co).
